data.title: Mary Irene Dougherty
data.text:
Notes for Mary Irene Dougherty

Obituary, The Canton Resository, Saturday, April 12, 1997, P. B2: Mary I. Crumrine - Mary I. Crumrine, pased away Thursday, April 10, 1997 in Columbia Mercy Medical Center, following a sudden illness. Mary was born May 31, 1924 in Woodsfield, OH, the daughter of the late Wade and Louisa (Turner) Dougherty. She was a member of St. Louis Catholic Church, St. Ann’s Altar & Rosary Society, the 39’s Senior Organganization and St. Paul’s Senior Club. Survivors include two sons and daughters-in-law, Colin and Beverly Crumrine of Louisville and Rollin and Judy Crumrine of East Canton; a sister, Ruth Briggs of East Sparta; five brothers, James and John both of Louisville, Francis of Akron, Fred of Woodsfield and Charles ofAlliance; five grandchildren, Ed Crumrine of Oregon, Tiffanie Crumrine of Louisville, Tara Crumrine of Hilton Head, SC, Rhonda and Rollin K. Crumrine, both of East Canton; three step-grandchildren, Lynn Preston of Minerva, Mary Calhoun of Canton and Lee Farnsworth of East Canton; a great-granddaughter, Rebecca Crumrine of Oregon and special friend Pete Ayers. She is preceded in death by a son, Edward who passed away August 14, 1966 and sister, Clara Wentz. A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated Monday at 10 a.m. in St. Louisville Catholic Church with Rev. Fr. Frederick Slaven officiating. Burial will be in the church cemetery. Friends may call Sunday 6-8 p.m. the Paquelet-Falk Funeral Home.

Divorced
